===Origin===
This group was a community of [[Inhomo supremis|Inhuman]] descendants with very little Inhuman DNA that lived in northern [[Minnesota (State)|Minnesota]], and that had tried to avoid [[Terrigenesis]] for 10,000 years.{{r|Inhuman #5}}

===Adopting Jason===
At some point, [[Martin (Inhuman) (Earth-616)|Martin]] and his wife adopted [[Jaycen (Earth-616)|Jaycen]], a child from [[Utolan|another Inhuman community]], rechristened Jason.{{r|Inhuman #5}} His father [[Dijyen (Earth-616)|Dijyen]] was killed on his way back to the [[Mozambique]]-based Inhuman community of [[Utolan]].{{r|All-New Inhumans #8}}

Raising Jason was hard, as, unaware of his true lineage, he felt kind of ostracized, and pictured himself as some kind of compensation for a white guilt Martin would had.{{r|Inhuman #5}}

===On the run from the [[Terrigen Cloud]]===
After the detonation of the [[Terrigen Bomb]] and the arrival of the [[Terrigen Cloud]] upon their town, the whole community tried to run away together. Martin had a hard time convincing Jason, recalling him that no matter their blood, he was his dad.{{r|Inhuman #5}}

Jason finally joined them in their buses, but the Cloud kept pursuing them, changing direction as if it was aimed toward them. Running out of luck, the community found the road cut off by a torrent.{{r|Inhuman #5}}

Despite [[Raymond (Inhuman) (Earth-616)|Raymond]]'s want to keep on, Martin abandoned the run, accepting his fate and explaining Jason that they were "special", just like the African group he was adopted from, as the Terrigen engulfed them all.{{r|Inhuman #5}}

===[[Terrigenesis]]===
Jason was the only one to emerge from his cocoon, only to meet [[Lash (Earth-616)|Lash]] who took him to [[Orollan]].{{r|Inhuman #5}}
